function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"High population of Diploma and Graduate education levels may lead to a higher likelihood of transmission due to increased social interaction","Impact":"Increased risk of disease transmission and spread within the construction workforce","Mitigation":"Implement strict social distancing measures and health protocols within the construction sites","Technologies":"Contact tracing apps and remote monitoring technologies for adherence to health protocols","People":"Construction workforce","Owner":"Construction companies and project managers"},{"Description":"Low number of respondents with PhD level of education may result in a lack of expertise in public health and disease control within the construction workforce","Impact":"Lack of expert guidance on disease control measures and strategies","Mitigation":"Engage public health experts for advice and consultation on disease control within construction sites","Technologies":"Remote consultations and virtual expert panels","People":"Construction workforce","Owner":"Construction companies and project managers"},{"Description":"Majority agreement on the provision of health and safety rule signage and protective equipment may lead to a false sense of security and reduced vigilance against disease transmission","Impact":"Complacency and reduced adherence to health protocols","Mitigation":"Regular training and reinforcement of health protocols, and transparent communication on the ongoing pandemic situation","Technologies":"E-learning platforms for continuous training and video conferencing for transparent communication","People":"Construction workforce","Owner":"Construction companies and project managers"}]}
